title: Magnetic field - orientation of magnetic dipoles

content.prompt: Two dipole magnets are mounted such that they can rotate freely around their respective centers of mass. Which of the following orientations of the two magnets is stable?

choices.label: Their north poles are facing each other.
Their south poles are facing each other.
They are side-by-side and anti-parallel to each other, with their north and south poles facing in opposite directions.
They are aligned end to end with their north poles facing right and their south poles facing left.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
